{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Banker, Business",
  "description": "Stanbic IBTC Bank is a leading African banking group focused on emerging markets globally. It has been a mainstay of South Africa&#39;s financial system for 150 years, and now spans 16 countries across the African continent.

Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for resourceful individuals to join our dedicated team at our offices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Banker, Business

Job Ref ID: 80428283A-0001
Job Location:&nbsp;Aba Road - Abia
Job Type: Full-time
Business Segment: Business &amp; Commercial Banking

Job Description


	Stanbic IBTC is positioned to continue to build capacity and create a sustainable talent pipeline within the organization.
	The organization is running a recruitment exercise for Relationship Managers to manage its existing portfolio of clients, while onboarding new clients/businesses.
	The key responsibilities listed below, show the required knowledge for sales and relationship management roles.
	Please send in your application if you have any knowledge of or interests in managing relationships and if you meet all the criteria required for this role.


Qualifications


	First degree in any field.
	Minimum of 3 - 6 years of experience
	Cognate experience in sales and relationship management of customers to be able to drive profitability and build relationships
	Experience within the financial industry with experience in managing small businesses.


Additional Information
Behavioural Competencies:


	Generating Ideas
	Developing Strategies
	Interpreting Data
	Convincing People
	Team Working


Technical Competencies:


	Customer Understanding
	Product Knowledge
	Application and Submission Verification
	Account opening and maintenance
	Product Related Systems.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-20",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-21",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Stanbic IBTC Bank"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abia",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "193282"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

      "minValue": 0,

}



Banker, Business Job at Stanbic IBTC Bank




        
    

        
        Stanbic IBTC Bank is a leading African banking group focused on emerging markets globally. It has been a mainstay of South Africa's financial system for 150 years, and now spans 16 countries across the African continent.

Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for resourceful individuals to join our dedicated team at our offices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Banker, Business
     

            
    



Job Ref ID: 80428283A-0001
Job Location: Aba Road - Abia
Job Type: Full-time
Business Segment: Business & Commercial Banking

Job Description


	Stanbic IBTC is positioned to continue to build capacity and create a sustainable talent pipeline within the organization.
	The organization is running a recruitment exercise for Relationship Managers to manage its existing portfolio of clients, while onboarding new clients/businesses.
	The key responsibilities listed below, show the required knowledge for sales and relationship management roles.
	Please send in your application if you have any knowledge of or interests in managing relationships and if you meet all the criteria required for this role.


Qualifications


	First degree in any field.
	Minimum of 3 - 6 years of experience
	Cognate experience in sales and relationship management of customers to be able to drive profitability and build relationships
	Experience within the financial industry with experience in managing small businesses.


Additional Information
Behavioural Competencies:


	Generating Ideas
	Developing Strategies
	Interpreting Data
	Convincing People
	Team Working


Technical Competencies:


	Customer Understanding
	Product Knowledge
	Application and Submission Verification
	Account opening and maintenance
	Product Related Systems.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Content Creator",
  "description": "Dews and Petals is a premium pest control and cleaning company operating in Abuja, Nigeria. Renowned for delivering expert pest management services, Dews and Petals is committed to creating healthier, pest-free environmentsthrough education and tailored solutions. With a strong reputation for excellence, Dews and Petals provides reliable and effective pest control solutions for residential and commercial properties.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator
Job Location:&nbsp;Gwarimpa, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Part-time

Responsibilities


	The Content Creator would be responsible for developing engaging blog posts, articles, and content on pest control topics.
	Manage and schedule social media content for Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok.
	Optimize content for SEO, researching and incorporating relevant keywords.
	Design graphics and short videos for digital marketing campaigns.
	Simplify technical pest control concepts for customer education.
	Collaborate with technicians, sales, and customer service teams for content accuracy.
	Analyze content performance using tools like Google Analytics and adjust strategies accordingly.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Minimum of 2 years of experience in content creation, social media management, or digital marketing.
	Preferably a male
	Must speak and understand Yoruba
	Strong writing and editing skills with the ability to engage different audiences.
	Knowledge of SEO, keyword research, and performance tracking tools.
	Basic proficiency in graphic design (Canva, Adobe Suite) and video editing.
	Creative mindset with attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects.
	Strong communication and teamwork.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-20",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Dews and Petals Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

Content Creator Job at Dews and Petals Limited




        
    

        
        Dews and Petals is a premium pest control and cleaning company operating in Abuja, Nigeria. Renowned for delivering expert pest management services, Dews and Petals is committed to creating healthier, pest-free environmentsthrough education and tailored solutions. With a strong reputation for excellence, Dews and Petals provides reliable and effective pest control solutions for residential and commercial properties.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator
Job Location: Gwarimpa, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Part-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	The Content Creator would be responsible for developing engaging blog posts, articles, and content on pest control topics.
	Manage and schedule social media content for Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok.
	Optimize content for SEO, researching and incorporating relevant keywords.
	Design graphics and short videos for digital marketing campaigns.
	Simplify technical pest control concepts for customer education.
	Collaborate with technicians, sales, and customer service teams for content accuracy.
	Analyze content performance using tools like Google Analytics and adjust strategies accordingly.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Minimum of 2 years of experience in content creation, social media management, or digital marketing.
	Preferably a male
	Must speak and understand Yoruba
	Strong writing and editing skills with the ability to engage different audiences.
	Knowledge of SEO, keyword research, and performance tracking tools.
	Basic proficiency in graphic design (Canva, Adobe Suite) and video editing.
	Creative mindset with attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects.
	Strong communication and teamwork.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Lead",
  "description": "Dotts Media House is Africa&#39;s award-winning media company, utilizing content, consulting, and strategy to inspire growth through campaigns, movements, and stories. With expertise in Advertising, Digital Marketing, Public Relations, Influencer Marketing, Corporate Communications, and more, our team collaborates with organizations aligned with our vision to #CoCreateMagic.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Lead
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Business Lead will be responsible for driving revenue growth, expanding client relationships, and identifying new business opportunities for the agency.
	This role bridges strategy, sales, and client management, ensuring the firm&rsquo;s offerings are effectively positioned and consistently converted into profitable engagements.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, pursue, and convert new business opportunities aligned with the agency&rsquo;s strategic goals
	Develop growth strategies across existing and new markets
	Lead pitch development, proposals, and contract negotiations
	Build and maintain a strong sales pipeline
	Serve as a senior point of contact for key clients
	Grow existing accounts through upselling and cross-selling services
	Ensure client satisfaction and long-term retention
	Translate client needs into clear briefs for internal teams
	Monitor market trends, competitor activity, and emerging opportunities
	Contribute to agency positioning, pricing strategies, and service innovation
	Work closely with creative, media, strategy, and operations teams to shape compelling value propositions &amp; ensure seamless delivery
	Support leadership in setting revenue targets and performance metrics &amp; tracking business development performance against targets
	Represent the agency at industry events, meetings, and networking opportunities
	Prepare regular reports on wins/losses
	Use insights to refine strategy, sales and growth approaches.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	New business revenue generated
	Client retention and account growth
	Conversion rate of pitches and proposals
	Strength and value of sales pipeline
	Contribution to overall agency growth.


Requirements


	Proven experience in client service, business development, sales within a marketing, advertising, or creative agency
	Strong understanding of marketing, influencers, digital, and advertising services
	Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
	Strategic thinker with a commercial mindset
	Ability to build trust and influence senior stakeholders.
	Strong organisational and pipeline management skills.


Ideal Candidate Profile:


	At least 5/6 years of Agency Experience
	Results-driven and commercially focused
	Confident relationship builder
	Comfortable leading conversations at C-suite level
	Proactive, adaptable, and growth-oriented.


Salary
N600,000 - N650,000 / month

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;jobs@dottsmediahouse.com&nbsp;using &quot;Business Lead&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

Business Lead Job at Dotts Media House




        
    

        
        Dotts Media House is Africa's award-winning media company, utilizing content, consulting, and strategy to inspire growth through campaigns, movements, and stories. With expertise in Advertising, Digital Marketing, Public Relations, Influencer Marketing, Corporate Communications, and more, our team collaborates with organizations aligned with our vision to #CoCreateMagic.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Lead
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Business Lead will be responsible for driving revenue growth, expanding client relationships, and identifying new business opportunities for the agency.
	This role bridges strategy, sales, and client management, ensuring the firm’s offerings are effectively positioned and consistently converted into profitable engagements.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, pursue, and convert new business opportunities aligned with the agency’s strategic goals
	Develop growth strategies across existing and new markets
	Lead pitch development, proposals, and contract negotiations
	Build and maintain a strong sales pipeline
	Serve as a senior point of contact for key clients
	Grow existing accounts through upselling and cross-selling services
	Ensure client satisfaction and long-term retention
	Translate client needs into clear briefs for internal teams
	Monitor market trends, competitor activity, and emerging opportunities
	Contribute to agency positioning, pricing strategies, and service innovation
	Work closely with creative, media, strategy, and operations teams to shape compelling value propositions & ensure seamless delivery
	Support leadership in setting revenue targets and performance metrics & tracking business development performance against targets
	Represent the agency at industry events, meetings, and networking opportunities
	Prepare regular reports on wins/losses
	Use insights to refine strategy, sales and growth approaches.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	New business revenue generated
	Client retention and account growth
	Conversion rate of pitches and proposals
	Strength and value of sales pipeline
	Contribution to overall agency growth.


Requirements


	Proven experience in client service, business development, sales within a marketing, advertising, or creative agency
	Strong understanding of marketing, influencers, digital, and advertising services
	Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
	Strategic thinker with a commercial mindset
	Ability to build trust and influence senior stakeholders.
	Strong organisational and pipeline management skills.


Ideal Candidate Profile:


	At least 5/6 years of Agency Experience
	Results-driven and commercially focused
	Confident relationship builder
	Comfortable leading conversations at C-suite level
	Proactive, adaptable, and growth-oriented.


Salary
N600,000 - N650,000 / month

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@dottsmediahouse.com using "Business Lead" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Warehouse Assistant / Picker Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is the most sought-after Human Resource Solution Provider with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We have a reputation for satisfying and surpassing clients' expectations through our core offerings: Recruitment and Selection, Outsourcing, Training and Development. To accomplish these, we leverage creating and managing change in organisations by improving efficiency through our proven and dynamic HR solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant / Picker

Job Location: Agbor, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a reliable Warehouse Assistant / Picker with at least two years of experience to support daily warehouse operations, including picking, packing, and stock handling.


Responsibilities


	Pick and pack orders accurately
	Receive, store, and organize stock
	Assist with loading and unloading goods
	Maintain cleanliness and order in the warehouse
	Follow safety and company procedures.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / SSCE qualification
	Minimum of 2 years of warehouse or picking experience
	Ability to lift and move items
	Basic reading and counting skills
	Reliable, detail-oriented, and able to work in a team.


Salary
N90,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "",
  "description": "SwiftSync Consulting is a global firm specializing in delivering tailored solutions to meet the unique needs of clients across government, corporate, and development sectors. With over 30 Associate Consultants bringing diverse expertise from various countries, we provide high-quality, value-driven services. Our strength lies in understanding client challenges and crafting customized strategies that yield measurable results.

We are recruiting to fill the positions below:

1.)&nbsp;Internal Auditor

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;

Responsibilties


	Execute risk-based audits across financial, maintenance, and operational departments.
	Evaluate the adequacy of technology controls and data integrity within core aviation systems.
	Collaborate with Management to implement corrective action plans and track remediation.
	Prepare detailed audit reports highlighting findings, root causes, and risk implications.
	Evaluate the design and operating effectiveness of internal controls across financial, operational, compliance, and IT environments.
	Serve as the primary liaison between Management and external auditors, ensuring effective coordination and timely support throughout the audit cycle.
	Stay current with aviation industry developments, regulatory requirements, and internal auditing best practices.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor`s Degree with 5 years of experience.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@swiftsync.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

2.)&nbsp;Charter Sourcing Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Source aircraft globally and maintain a live database of partner operators and pricing.
	Negotiate rates, ferry costs, and contract terms for high-value client requests.
	Conduct due diligence to ensure all sourced aircraft meet NCAA, ICAO, and EASA safety standards.
	Provide 24/7 sourcing support and produce weekly market intelligence reports.
	Monitor charter price trends, fleet changes, repositioning patterns, and seasonal demand.
	Identify underserved route opportunities and recommend strategic network development actions.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with operators, charter brokers, trip support companies, and dispatchers.
	Review operator compliance with safety management systems (SMS), IOSA/IS-BAO standards, crew qualifications, and operational specifications.
	Prepare and deliver quick, accurate, and competitive charter quotes.
	Liaise with Operations Control, Scheduling, Finance, and Legal teams on charter confirmation.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@swiftsync.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

&nbsp;

3.)&nbsp;Group Charter Sales Specialist (ERJ-145 Fleet)

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	The Group Charter Sales Specialist (ERJ-145) is responsible for driving all group charter sales using our client&#39;s dedicated Embraer ERJ-145 aircraft.
	The role focuses exclusively on selling, planning, and coordinating group charters for 30&ndash;50 passengers using the ERJ-145 across Nigeria, West Africa, and other approved international routes.
	The role ensures maximum aircraft utilization, strong client relationships, compliance with operational requirements, and commercial profitability across all ERJ-145 charter missions.


Key Responsibilities


	Sell ERJ-145 group charters to corporates, government agencies, sports teams, tour operators, and private groups.
	Develop ERJ-145 pricing models and cost-optimized routing options.
	Identify seasonal demand patterns and propose charter programs to maximize fleet usage.
	Prepare commercial justifications for new markets and high-demand sectors.
	Prepare competitive, cost-optimized proposals and detailed flight itineraries.
	Build strong relationships with corporates, travel managers, protocol units, and group clients.
	Liaise with Operations and Ground Handling to ensure seamless group movements.
	Prepare quarterly market analysis reports highlighting new charter opportunities.
	Maintain an active CRM pipeline of all ERJ-145 charter leads, opportunities, and conversions.
	Ensure all group travel complies with NCAA, ICAO, and international operational requirements.
	Provide on-site problem resolution for large charter groups.
	Ensure proper branding, corporate representation, and customer experience at departure locations.


Required Skills &amp; Qualifications


	Qualification: Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business, Marketing, or Aviation.
	Experience: 3&ndash;7 years in charter sales or airline commercial roles with a strong industry network.
	Skills: Expertise in regional jet operations (ERJ-145), professional negotiation, and high-volume digital communication.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;careers@swiftsync.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-30",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Swiftsync Consulting Company"
    
  },

Job Opening at SwiftSync Consulting




        
    

        
        SwiftSync Consulting is a global firm specializing in delivering tailored solutions to meet the unique needs of clients across government, corporate, and development sectors. With over 30 Associate Consultants bringing diverse expertise from various countries, we provide high-quality, value-driven services. Our strength lies in understanding client challenges and crafting customized strategies that yield measurable results.

We are recruiting to fill the positions below:

1.) Internal Auditor

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 

Responsibilties
     

            
    




	Execute risk-based audits across financial, maintenance, and operational departments.
	Evaluate the adequacy of technology controls and data integrity within core aviation systems.
	Collaborate with Management to implement corrective action plans and track remediation.
	Prepare detailed audit reports highlighting findings, root causes, and risk implications.
	Evaluate the design and operating effectiveness of internal controls across financial, operational, compliance, and IT environments.
	Serve as the primary liaison between Management and external auditors, ensuring effective coordination and timely support throughout the audit cycle.
	Stay current with aviation industry developments, regulatory requirements, and internal auditing best practices.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor`s Degree with 5 years of experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@swiftsync.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Charter Sourcing Specialist

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Source aircraft globally and maintain a live database of partner operators and pricing.
	Negotiate rates, ferry costs, and contract terms for high-value client requests.
	Conduct due diligence to ensure all sourced aircraft meet NCAA, ICAO, and EASA safety standards.
	Provide 24/7 sourcing support and produce weekly market intelligence reports.
	Monitor charter price trends, fleet changes, repositioning patterns, and seasonal demand.
	Identify underserved route opportunities and recommend strategic network development actions.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with operators, charter brokers, trip support companies, and dispatchers.
	Review operator compliance with safety management systems (SMS), IOSA/IS-BAO standards, crew qualifications, and operational specifications.
	Prepare and deliver quick, accurate, and competitive charter quotes.
	Liaise with Operations Control, Scheduling, Finance, and Legal teams on charter confirmation.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@swiftsync.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Group Charter Sales Specialist (ERJ-145 Fleet)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	The Group Charter Sales Specialist (ERJ-145) is responsible for driving all group charter sales using our client's dedicated Embraer ERJ-145 aircraft.
	The role focuses exclusively on selling, planning, and coordinating group charters for 30–50 passengers using the ERJ-145 across Nigeria, West Africa, and other approved international routes.
	The role ensures maximum aircraft utilization, strong client relationships, compliance with operational requirements, and commercial profitability across all ERJ-145 charter missions.


Key Responsibilities


	Sell ERJ-145 group charters to corporates, government agencies, sports teams, tour operators, and private groups.
	Develop ERJ-145 pricing models and cost-optimized routing options.
	Identify seasonal demand patterns and propose charter programs to maximize fleet usage.
	Prepare commercial justifications for new markets and high-demand sectors.
	Prepare competitive, cost-optimized proposals and detailed flight itineraries.
	Build strong relationships with corporates, travel managers, protocol units, and group clients.
	Liaise with Operations and Ground Handling to ensure seamless group movements.
	Prepare quarterly market analysis reports highlighting new charter opportunities.
	Maintain an active CRM pipeline of all ERJ-145 charter leads, opportunities, and conversions.
	Ensure all group travel complies with NCAA, ICAO, and international operational requirements.
	Provide on-site problem resolution for large charter groups.
	Ensure proper branding, corporate representation, and customer experience at departure locations.


Required Skills & Qualifications


	Qualification: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or Aviation.
	Experience: 3–7 years in charter sales or airline commercial roles with a strong industry network.
	Skills: Expertise in regional jet operations (ERJ-145), professional negotiation, and high-volume digital communication.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers@swiftsync.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
